meanings.definition: To remove or take out (something) from a place
meanings.sent1: She carefully extracts the key from the lock.
meanings.sent2: The dentist extracts a tooth to relieve the pain.
meanings.sent3: The magician extracts a rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent4: The detective extracts the truth from the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist extracts ancient artifacts from the ground.

meanings.definition: A concentrated substance made by removing water or other substances from a liquid
meanings.sent1: The vanilla extract adds flavor to the cake.
meanings.sent2: She uses almond extract in her baking recipes.
meanings.sent3: The chef adds a drop of lemon extract for a zesty taste.
meanings.sent4: The perfume contains rose extract for a floral scent.
meanings.sent5: The medicine includes herbal extracts for healing properties.

meanings.definition: A short passage taken from a book, film, etc.
meanings.sent1: The teacher read an extract from the novel to the class.
meanings.sent2: He quoted an extract from the speech during his presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian performed a hilarious extract from the movie.
meanings.sent4: The musician played an emotional extract from the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The actor memorized an extract from the play for the audition.
